Blog.post: Moms, ya gotta love em and you gotta have one, but geesh! This is going overboard! My mom's lost her mind...figuratively, ofcourse. She's buying a new house...well, another house...can't for the life of me figure out why, the old house was just fine..by "just fine", I mean nobody has to do anything to it. Well, anyway, she bought another one....that must be 100 million years old!!!! Luckily, my brother is a plasterer, my husband is a painter, my youngest brother in a jack of all trades and I'm a interior designer. Lucky for her. :O) She should have had one more kid and he could have been a carpet installer or hard wood floor refinisher. She's got all of us fixing up this house and not being very generous on the time frame..we have to finish the palstering, the painting, find a carpet installer (and the carpet), install all the bathroom fixtures, hand blinds and curtains, tile the kitchen and bathroom floors, change the kitchen cabinet arrangement and build a dog run for her 3 dogs (now that's another story all in itself!) And we have to have all this done and move her stuff in by THIS SATURDAY!!!! I'm rolling on the floor laughing and she's looking at me so seriously its almost scarey. My family is extremely good at getting things done right and fast, but this is just a little more pressure than I'm used to. I can't wait until its over...maybe by sunday? I can only hope... See Ya ~ Kelli

Ok, today was quite interesting...the day was going fine until all of sudden my 15 month old knocked over the torch lamp which fell into the side of the fish tank causing it to crack. Yup, you guessed it, we had a fish emergency. My 8 year old helped me bail out the water down under the crack(s). All 7 survivors were still surviving until I switched them to another tank....we have 3 fish left..for now. Its a sad day here, we've had multiple deaths.
